     275             : 
     276             : /**
     277             :  * A wrapper for an imgRequestProxy that supports off-main-thread creation
     278             :  * and equality comparison.
     279             :  *
     280             :  * An nsStyleImageRequest can be created in two ways:
     281             :  *
     282             :  * 1. Using the constructor that takes an imgRequestProxy.  This must
     283             :  *    be called from the main thread.  The nsStyleImageRequest is
     284             :  *    immediately considered "resolved", and the get() method that
     285             :  *    returns the imgRequestProxy can be called.
     286             :  *
     287             :  * 2. Using the constructor that takes the URL, base URI, referrer
     288             :  *    and principal that can be used to inititiate an image load and
     289             :  *    produce an imgRequestProxy later.  This can be called from
     290             :  *    any thread.  The nsStyleImageRequest is not considered "resolved"
     291             :  *    at this point, and the Resolve() method must be called later
     292             :  *    to initiate the image load and make calls to get() valid.
     293             :  *
     294             :  * Calls to TrackImage(), UntrackImage(), LockImage(), UnlockImage() and
     295             :  * RequestDiscard() are made to the imgRequestProxy and ImageTracker as
     296             :  * appropriate, according to the mode flags passed in to the constructor.
     297             :  *
     298             :  * The main thread constructor takes a pointer to the css::ImageValue that
     299             :  * is the specified url() value, while the off-main-thread constructor
     300             :  * creates a new css::ImageValue to represent the url() information passed
     301             :  * to the constructor.  This ImageValue is held on to for the comparisons done
     302             :  * in DefinitelyEquals(), so that we don't need to call into the non-OMT-safe
     303             :  * Equals() on the nsIURI objects returned from imgRequestProxy::GetURI().
     304             :  */
     305             : class nsStyleImageRequest
     306             : {
     307             : public:
     308             :   typedef mozilla::css::URLValueData URLValueData;
     309             : 
     310             :   // Flags describing whether the imgRequestProxy must be tracked in the
     311             :   // ImageTracker, whether LockImage/UnlockImage calls will be made
     312             :   // when obtaining and releasing the imgRequestProxy, and whether
     313             :   // RequestDiscard will be called on release.
     314             :   enum class Mode : uint8_t {
     315             :     // The imgRequestProxy will be added to the ImageTracker when resolved
     316             :     // Without this flag, the nsStyleImageRequest itself will call LockImage/
     317             :     // UnlockImage on the imgRequestProxy, rather than leaving locking to the
     318             :     // ImageTracker to manage.
     319             :     //
     320             :     // This flag is currently used by all nsStyleImageRequests except
     321             :     // those for list-style-image and cursor.
     322             :     Track = 0x1,
     323             : 
     324             :     // The imgRequestProxy will have its RequestDiscard method called when
     325             :     // the nsStyleImageRequest is going away.
     326             :     //
     327             :     // This is currently used only for cursor images.
     328             :     Discard = 0x2,
     329             :   };
     330             : 
     331             :   // Must be called from the main thread.
     332             :   //
     333             :   // aImageTracker must be non-null iff aModeFlags contains Track.
     334             :   nsStyleImageRequest(Mode aModeFlags,
     335             :                       imgRequestProxy* aRequestProxy,
     336             :                       mozilla::css::ImageValue* aImageValue,
     337             :                       mozilla::dom::ImageTracker* aImageTracker);
     338             : 
     339             :   // Can be called from any thread, but Resolve() must be called later
     340             :   // on the main thread before get() can be used.
     341             :   nsStyleImageRequest(
     342             :       Mode aModeFlags,
     343             :       const nsAString& aURL,
     344             :       already_AddRefed<mozilla::URLExtraData> aExtraData);
     345             : 
     346             :   bool Resolve(nsPresContext* aPresContext);
     347             :   bool IsResolved() const { return mResolved; }
     348             : 
     349             :   imgRequestProxy* get() {
     350             :     MOZ_ASSERT(IsResolved(), "Resolve() must be called first");
     351             :     MOZ_ASSERT(NS_IsMainThread());
     352             :     return mRequestProxy.get();
     353             :   }
     354             :   const imgRequestProxy* get() const {
     355             :     return const_cast<nsStyleImageRequest*>(this)->get();
     356             :   }
     357             : 
     358             :   // Returns whether the ImageValue objects in the two nsStyleImageRequests
     359             :   // return true from URLValueData::DefinitelyEqualURIs.
     360             :   bool DefinitelyEquals(const nsStyleImageRequest& aOther) const;
     361             : 
     362             :   mozilla::css::ImageValue* GetImageValue() const { return mImageValue; }
     363             : 
     364             :   already_AddRefed<nsIURI> GetImageURI() const;
     365             :   NS_INLINE_DECL_THREADSAFE_REFCOUNTING(nsStyleImageRequest);
     366             : 
     367             : private:
     368             :   ~nsStyleImageRequest();
     369             :   nsStyleImageRequest& operator=(const nsStyleImageRequest& aOther) = delete;
     370             : 
     371             :   void MaybeTrackAndLock();
     372             : 
     373             :   RefPtr<imgRequestProxy> mRequestProxy;
     374             :   RefPtr<mozilla::css::ImageValue> mImageValue;
     375             :   RefPtr<mozilla::dom::ImageTracker> mImageTracker;

     377             :   // Cache DocGroup for dispatching events in the destructor.

     379             : 
     380             :   Mode mModeFlags;
     381             :   bool mResolved;
     382             : };

     412             : /**
     413             :  * Represents a paintable image of one of the following types.
     414             :  * (1) A real image loaded from an external source.
     415             :  * (2) A CSS linear or radial gradient.
     416             :  * (3) An element within a document, or an <img>, <video>, or <canvas> element
     417             :  *     not in a document.
     418             :  * (*) Optionally a crop rect can be set to paint a partial (rectangular)
     419             :  * region of an image. (Currently, this feature is only supported with an
     420             :  * image of type (1)).
     421             :  */

     475             :   /**
     476             :    * Compute the actual crop rect in pixels, using the source image bounds.

     478             :    * clamping each side value to fit in the source image bounds.
     479             :    * @param aActualCropRect the computed actual crop rect.
     480             :    * @param aIsEntireImage true iff |aActualCropRect| is identical to the
     481             :    * source image bounds.

     486             : 
     487             :   /**
     488             :    * Starts the decoding of a image. Returns true if the current frame of the
     489             :    * image is complete. The return value is intended to be used instead of
     490             :    * IsComplete because IsComplete may not be up to date if notifications
     491             :    * from decoding are pending because they are being sent async.

     519             :     // percentage unit, which can not be evaluated until the source image size

     976             :   nsBorderColors() : mNext(nullptr), mColor(NS_RGB(0,0,0)) {}

     978             :   ~nsBorderColors();

     980             :   nsBorderColors* Clone() const { return Clone(true); }
     981             : 
     982             :   static bool Equal(const nsBorderColors* c1,
     983             :                       const nsBorderColors* c2) {
     984             :     if (c1 == c2) {
     985             :       return true;
     986             :     }
     987             :     while (c1 && c2) {
     988             :       if (c1->mColor != c2->mColor) {
     989             :         return false;
     990             :       }
     991             :       c1 = c1->mNext;
     992             :       c2 = c2->mNext;
     993             :     }
     994             :     // both should be nullptr if these are equal, otherwise one
     995             :     // has more colors than another
     996             :     return !c1 && !c2;
     997             :   }
     998             : 
     999             : private:
    1000             :   nsBorderColors* Clone(bool aDeep) const;

    1035             : class nsCSSShadowArray final
    1036             : {
    1037             : public:
    1038             :   void* operator new(size_t aBaseSize, uint32_t aArrayLen) {
    1039             :     // We can allocate both this nsCSSShadowArray and the
    1040             :     // actual array in one allocation. The amount of memory to
    1041             :     // allocate is equal to the class's size + the number of bytes for all
    1042             :     // but the first array item (because aBaseSize includes one
    1043             :     // item, see the private declarations)

    1045             :                           (aArrayLen - 1) * sizeof(nsCSSShadowItem));
    1046             :   }
    1047             : 
    1048             :   explicit nsCSSShadowArray(uint32_t aArrayLen) :
    1049             :     mLength(aArrayLen)
    1050             :   {
    1051             :     for (uint32_t i = 1; i < mLength; ++i) {
    1052             :       // Make sure we call the constructors of each nsCSSShadowItem
    1053             :       // (the first one is called for us because we declared it under private)
    1054             :       new (&mArray[i]) nsCSSShadowItem();

    1106             : 
    1107             : // Border widths are rounded to the nearest-below integer number of pixels,
    1108             : // but values between zero and one device pixels are always rounded up to
    1109             : // one device pixel.
    1110             : #define NS_ROUND_BORDER_TO_PIXELS(l,tpp) \
    1111             :   ((l) == 0) ? 0 : std::max((tpp), (l) / (tpp) * (tpp))
    1112             : // Outline offset is rounded to the nearest integer number of pixels, but values
    1113             : // between zero and one device pixels are always rounded up to one device pixel.
    1114             : // Note that the offset can be negative.
    1115             : #define NS_ROUND_OFFSET_TO_PIXELS(l,tpp) \
    1116             :   (((l) == 0) ? 0 : \
    1117             :     ((l) > 0) ? std::max( (tpp), ((l) + ((tpp) / 2)) / (tpp) * (tpp)) : \
    1118             :                 std::min(-(tpp), ((l) - ((tpp) / 2)) / (tpp) * (tpp)))
    1119             : 
    1120             : // Returns if the given border style type is visible or not
    1121             : static bool IsVisibleBorderStyle(uint8_t aStyle)
    1122             : {
    1123             :   return (aStyle != NS_STYLE_BORDER_STYLE_NONE &&
    1124             :           aStyle != NS_STYLE_BORDER_STYLE_HIDDEN);
    1125             : }

    1503             :   // http://dev.w3.org/csswg/css-grid/#typedef-grid-line
    1504             :   // XXXmats we could optimize memory size here
    1505             :   bool mHasSpan;
    1506             :   int32_t mInteger;  // 0 means not provided
    1507             :   nsString mLineName;  // Empty string means not provided.
    1508             : 
    1509             :   // These are the limits that we choose to clamp grid line numbers to.
    1510             :   // http://dev.w3.org/csswg/css-grid/#overlarge-grids
    1511             :   // mInteger is clamped to this range:
    1512             :   static const int32_t kMinLine = -10000;
    1513             :   static const int32_t kMaxLine = 10000;
    1514             : 
    1515             :   nsStyleGridLine()

    1517             :     , mInteger(0)
    1518             :     // mLineName get its default constructor, the empty string
    1519             :   {
    1520             :   }

    1562             :   }
    1563             : };
    1564             : 
    1565             : // Computed value of the grid-template-columns or grid-template-rows property
    1566             : // (but *not* grid-template-areas.)
    1567             : // http://dev.w3.org/csswg/css-grid/#track-sizing
    1568             : //
    1569             : // This represents either:
    1570             : // * none:
    1571             : //   mIsSubgrid is false, all three arrays are empty
    1572             : // * <track-list>:
    1573             : //   mIsSubgrid is false,
    1574             : //   mMinTrackSizingFunctions and mMaxTrackSizingFunctions
    1575             : //   are of identical non-zero size,
    1576             : //   and mLineNameLists is one element longer than that.
    1577             : //   (Delimiting N columns requires N+1 lines:
    1578             : //   one before each track, plus one at the very end.)
    1579             : //
    1580             : //   An omitted <line-names> is still represented in mLineNameLists,
    1581             : //   as an empty sub-array.
    1582             : //
    1583             : //   A <track-size> specified as a single <track-breadth> is represented
    1584             : //   as identical min and max sizing functions.
    1585             : //   A 'fit-content(size)' <track-size> is represented as eStyleUnit_None
    1586             : //   in the min sizing function and 'size' in the max sizing function.
    1587             : //
    1588             : //   The units for nsStyleCoord are:
    1589             : //   * eStyleUnit_Percent represents a <percentage>
    1590             : //   * eStyleUnit_FlexFraction represents a <flex> flexible fraction
    1591             : //   * eStyleUnit_Coord represents a <length>
    1592             : //   * eStyleUnit_Enumerated represents min-content or max-content
    1593             : // * subgrid <line-name-list>?:
    1594             : //   mIsSubgrid is true,
    1595             : //   mLineNameLists may or may not be empty,
    1596             : //   mMinTrackSizingFunctions and mMaxTrackSizingFunctions are empty.
    1597             : //
    1598             : // If mRepeatAutoIndex != -1 then that index is an <auto-repeat> and
    1599             : // mIsAutoFill == true means it's an 'auto-fill', otherwise 'auto-fit'.
    1600             : // mRepeatAutoLineNameListBefore is the list of line names before the track
    1601             : // size, mRepeatAutoLineNameListAfter the names after.  (They are empty
    1602             : // when there is no <auto-repeat> track, i.e. when mRepeatAutoIndex == -1).
    1603             : // When mIsSubgrid is true, mRepeatAutoLineNameListBefore contains the line
    1604             : // names and mRepeatAutoLineNameListAfter is empty.
    1605             : struct nsStyleGridTemplate
    1606             : {
    1607             :   nsTArray<nsTArray<nsString>> mLineNameLists;
    1608             :   nsTArray<nsStyleCoord> mMinTrackSizingFunctions;
    1609             :   nsTArray<nsStyleCoord> mMaxTrackSizingFunctions;
    1610             :   nsTArray<nsString> mRepeatAutoLineNameListBefore;
    1611             :   nsTArray<nsString> mRepeatAutoLineNameListAfter;
    1612             :   int16_t mRepeatAutoIndex; // -1 or the track index for an auto-fill/fit track
    1613             :   bool mIsAutoFill : 1;
    1614             :   bool mIsSubgrid : 1;
    1615             : 
    1616             :   nsStyleGridTemplate()
    1617             :     : mRepeatAutoIndex(-1)
    1618             :     , mIsAutoFill(false)
    1619             :     , mIsSubgrid(false)
    1620             :   {
    1621             :   }
    1622             : 
    1623             :   inline bool operator!=(const nsStyleGridTemplate& aOther) const {
    1624             :     return
    1625             :       mIsSubgrid != aOther.mIsSubgrid ||
    1626             :       mLineNameLists != aOther.mLineNameLists ||
    1627             :       mMinTrackSizingFunctions != aOther.mMinTrackSizingFunctions ||
    1628             :       mMaxTrackSizingFunctions != aOther.mMaxTrackSizingFunctions ||
    1629             :       mIsAutoFill != aOther.mIsAutoFill ||
    1630             :       mRepeatAutoIndex != aOther.mRepeatAutoIndex ||
    1631             :       mRepeatAutoLineNameListBefore != aOther.mRepeatAutoLineNameListBefore ||
    1632             :       mRepeatAutoLineNameListAfter != aOther.mRepeatAutoLineNameListAfter;
    1633             :   }
    1634             : 
    1635             :   bool HasRepeatAuto() const {
    1636             :     return mRepeatAutoIndex != -1;
    1637             :   }
    1638             : 
    1639             :   bool IsRepeatAutoIndex(uint32_t aIndex) const {
    1640             :     MOZ_ASSERT(aIndex < uint32_t(2*nsStyleGridLine::kMaxLine));
    1641             :     return int32_t(aIndex) == mRepeatAutoIndex;
    1642             :   }
    1643             : };

    1740             :       return mWidth.GetUnit() == eStyleUnit_Auto ||
    1741             :         WidthCoordDependsOnContainer(mWidth);

    1743             : 
    1744             :   // NOTE: For a flex item, "min-width:auto" is supposed to behave like
    1745             :   // "min-content", which does depend on the container, so you might think we'd
    1746             :   // need a special case for "flex item && min-width:auto" here.  However,
    1747             :   // we don't actually need that special-case code, because flex items are
    1748             :   // explicitly supposed to *ignore* their min-width (i.e. behave like it's 0)
    1749             :   // until the flex container explicitly considers it.  So -- since the flex
    1750             :   // container doesn't rely on this method, we don't need to worry about
    1751             :   // special behavior for flex items' "min-width:auto" values here.
    1752             :   bool MinWidthDependsOnContainer() const
    1753             :     { return WidthCoordDependsOnContainer(mMinWidth); }
    1754             :   bool MaxWidthDependsOnContainer() const
    1755             :     { return WidthCoordDependsOnContainer(mMaxWidth); }
    1756             : 
    1757             :   // Note that these functions count 'auto' as depending on the
    1758             :   // container since that's the case for absolutely positioned elements.
    1759             :   // However, some callers do not care about this case and should check
    1760             :   // for it, since it is the most common case.
    1761             :   // FIXME: We should probably change the assumption to be the other way
    1762             :   // around.
    1763             :   // Consider this as part of moving to the logical-coordinate APIs.
    1764             :   bool HeightDependsOnContainer() const
    1765             :     {
    1766             :       return mHeight.GetUnit() == eStyleUnit_Auto || // CSS 2.1, 10.6.4, item (5)

    1770             :   // NOTE: The comment above MinWidthDependsOnContainer about flex items
    1771             :   // applies here, too.

    1773             :     { return HeightCoordDependsOnContainer(mMinHeight); }
    1774             :   bool MaxHeightDependsOnContainer() const

    1841             :                  aDirection == NS_STYLE_DIRECTION_RTL, "bad direction");

    1843             :              mLeft : mRight;
    1844             :   }
    1845             :

    1849             :                  aDirection == NS_STYLE_DIRECTION_RTL, "bad direction");

    1851             :              mRight : mLeft;
    1852             :   }
    1853             : 
    1854             :   // Returns the first value that was specified.
    1855             :   const nsStyleTextOverflowSide* GetFirstValue() const {
    1856             :     return mLogicalDirections ? &mRight : &mLeft;
    1857             :   }
    1858             : 
    1859             :   // Returns the second value, or null if there was only one value specified.
    1860             :   const nsStyleTextOverflowSide* GetSecondValue() const {
    1861             :     return mLogicalDirections ? nullptr : &mRight;
    1862             :   }
    1863             : 
    1864             :   nsStyleTextOverflowSide mLeft;  // start side when mLogicalDirections is true
    1865             :   nsStyleTextOverflowSide mRight; // end side when mLogicalDirections is true
    1866             :   bool mLogicalDirections;  // true when only one value was specified

    2017             : struct nsStyleImageOrientation
    2018             : {
    2019             :   static nsStyleImageOrientation CreateAsAngleAndFlip(double aRadians,
    2020             :                                                       bool aFlip) {
    2021             :     uint8_t orientation(0);
    2022             : 
    2023             :     // Compute the final angle value, rounding to the closest quarter turn.
    2024             :     double roundedAngle = fmod(aRadians, 2 * M_PI);
    2025             :     if      (roundedAngle < 0.25 * M_PI) { orientation = ANGLE_0;  }
    2026             :     else if (roundedAngle < 0.75 * M_PI) { orientation = ANGLE_90; }
    2027             :     else if (roundedAngle < 1.25 * M_PI) { orientation = ANGLE_180;}
    2028             :     else if (roundedAngle < 1.75 * M_PI) { orientation = ANGLE_270;}
    2029             :     else                                 { orientation = ANGLE_0;  }
    2030             : 
    2031             :     // Add a bit for 'flip' if needed.
    2032             :     if (aFlip) {
    2033             :       orientation |= FLIP_MASK;
    2034             :     }
    2035             : 
    2036             :     return nsStyleImageOrientation(orientation);
    2037             :   }
    2038             : 
    2039             :   static nsStyleImageOrientation CreateAsFlip() {
    2040             :     return nsStyleImageOrientation(FLIP_MASK);
    2041             :   }
    2042             : 
    2043             :   static nsStyleImageOrientation CreateAsFromImage() {
    2044             :     return nsStyleImageOrientation(FROM_IMAGE_MASK);
    2045             :   }
    2046             : 
    2047             :   // The default constructor yields 0 degrees of rotation and no flip.
    2048             :   nsStyleImageOrientation() : mOrientation(0) { }
    2049             : 
    2050             :   bool IsDefault()   const { return mOrientation == 0; }
    2051             :   bool IsFlipped()   const { return mOrientation & FLIP_MASK; }
    2052             :   bool IsFromImage() const { return mOrientation & FROM_IMAGE_MASK; }
    2053             :   bool SwapsWidthAndHeight() const {
    2054             :     uint8_t angle = mOrientation & ORIENTATION_MASK;
    2055             :     return (angle == ANGLE_90) || (angle == ANGLE_270);
    2056             :   }
    2057             : 
    2058             :   mozilla::image::Angle Angle() const {
    2059             :     switch (mOrientation & ORIENTATION_MASK) {
    2060             :       case ANGLE_0:   return mozilla::image::Angle::D0;
    2061             :       case ANGLE_90:  return mozilla::image::Angle::D90;
    2062             :       case ANGLE_180: return mozilla::image::Angle::D180;
    2063             :       case ANGLE_270: return mozilla::image::Angle::D270;
    2064             :       default:
    2065             :         NS_NOTREACHED("Unexpected angle");
    2066             :         return mozilla::image::Angle::D0;
    2067             :     }
    2068             :   }
    2069             : 
    2070             :   nsStyleCoord AngleAsCoord() const {
    2071             :     switch (mOrientation & ORIENTATION_MASK) {
    2072             :       case ANGLE_0:   return nsStyleCoord(0.0f,   eStyleUnit_Degree);
    2073             :       case ANGLE_90:  return nsStyleCoord(90.0f,  eStyleUnit_Degree);
    2074             :       case ANGLE_180: return nsStyleCoord(180.0f, eStyleUnit_Degree);
    2075             :       case ANGLE_270: return nsStyleCoord(270.0f, eStyleUnit_Degree);
    2076             :       default:
    2077             :         NS_NOTREACHED("Unexpected angle");
    2078             :         return nsStyleCoord();
    2079             :     }
    2080             :   }
    2081             :

    2083             :     return aOther.mOrientation == mOrientation;

    2085             : 
    2086             :   bool operator!=(const nsStyleImageOrientation& aOther) const {
    2087             :     return !(*this == aOther);

    2090             : protected:
    2091             :   enum Bits {
    2092             :     ORIENTATION_MASK = 0x1 | 0x2,  // The bottom two bits are the angle.
    2093             :     FLIP_MASK        = 0x4,        // Whether the image should be flipped.
    2094             :     FROM_IMAGE_MASK  = 0x8,        // Whether the image's inherent orientation

    2151             : struct nsTimingFunction
    2152             : {
    2153             : 
    2154             :   enum class Type {
    2155             :     Ease,         // ease
    2156             :     Linear,       // linear
    2157             :     EaseIn,       // ease-in
    2158             :     EaseOut,      // ease-out
    2159             :     EaseInOut,    // ease-in-out
    2160             :     StepStart,    // step-start and steps(..., start)
    2161             :     StepEnd,      // step-end, steps(..., end) and steps(...)
    2162             :     CubicBezier,  // cubic-bezier()
    2163             :     Frames,       // frames()
    2164             :   };
    2165             : 
    2166             :   // Whether the timing function type is represented by a spline,
    2167             :   // and thus will have mFunc filled in.
    2168             :   static bool IsSplineType(Type aType)
    2169             :   {
    2170             :     return aType != Type::StepStart &&
    2171             :            aType != Type::StepEnd &&
    2172             :            aType != Type::Frames;
    2173             :   }
    2174             : 
    2175             :   explicit nsTimingFunction(int32_t aTimingFunctionType
    2176             :                               = NS_STYLE_TRANSITION_TIMING_FUNCTION_EASE)
    2177             :   {
    2178           0 :     AssignFromKeyword(aTimingFunctionType);
    2179             :   }
    2180             : 
    2181             :   nsTimingFunction(float x1, float y1, float x2, float y2)
    2182           0 :     : mType(Type::CubicBezier)
    2183             :   {
    2184           0 :     mFunc.mX1 = x1;
    2185           0 :     mFunc.mY1 = y1;
    2186           0 :     mFunc.mX2 = x2;
    2187           0 :     mFunc.mY2 = y2;
    2188             :   }
    2189             : 
    2190             :   enum class Keyword { Implicit, Explicit };
    2191             : 
    2192             :   nsTimingFunction(Type aType, uint32_t aStepsOrFrames)
    2193             :     : mType(aType)
    2194             :   {
    2195             :     MOZ_ASSERT(mType == Type::StepStart ||
    2196             :                mType == Type::StepEnd ||
    2197             :                mType == Type::Frames,
    2198             :                "wrong type");
    2199             :     mStepsOrFrames = aStepsOrFrames;
    2200             :   }
    2201             : 
    2202             :   nsTimingFunction(const nsTimingFunction& aOther)
    2203             :   {
    2204             :     *this = aOther;
    2205             :   }
    2206             : 
    2207             :   Type mType;
    2208             :   union {
    2209             :     struct {
    2210             :       float mX1;
    2211             :       float mY1;
    2212             :       float mX2;
    2213             :       float mY2;
    2214             :     } mFunc;
    2215             :     struct {
    2216             :       uint32_t mStepsOrFrames;
    2217             :     };
    2218             :   };
    2219             : 
    2220             :   nsTimingFunction&
    2221             :   operator=(const nsTimingFunction& aOther)
    2222             :   {
    2223             :     if (&aOther == this) {
    2224             :       return *this;
    2225             :     }
    2226             : 
    2227             :     mType = aOther.mType;
    2228             : 
    2229             :     if (HasSpline()) {
    2230             :       mFunc.mX1 = aOther.mFunc.mX1;
    2231             :       mFunc.mY1 = aOther.mFunc.mY1;
    2232             :       mFunc.mX2 = aOther.mFunc.mX2;
    2233             :       mFunc.mY2 = aOther.mFunc.mY2;
    2234             :     } else {
    2235             :       mStepsOrFrames = aOther.mStepsOrFrames;
    2236             :     }
    2237             : 
    2238             :     return *this;
    2239             :   }
    2240             : 
    2241             :   bool operator==(const nsTimingFunction& aOther) const
    2242             :   {
    2243             :     if (mType != aOther.mType) {
    2244             :       return false;
    2245             :     }
    2246             :     if (HasSpline()) {
    2247             :       return mFunc.mX1 == aOther.mFunc.mX1 && mFunc.mY1 == aOther.mFunc.mY1 &&
    2248             :              mFunc.mX2 == aOther.mFunc.mX2 && mFunc.mY2 == aOther.mFunc.mY2;
    2249             :     }
    2250             :     return mStepsOrFrames == aOther.mStepsOrFrames;
    2251             :   }
    2252             : 
    2253             :   bool operator!=(const nsTimingFunction& aOther) const
    2254             :   {
    2255             :     return !(*this == aOther);
    2256             :   }
    2257             : 
    2258             :   bool HasSpline() const { return IsSplineType(mType); }
    2259             : 
    2260             : private:
    2261             :   void AssignFromKeyword(int32_t aTimingFunctionType);
    2262             : };

    2620             : // Consumers expect to be able to null-test mBinding to determine whether there
    2621             : // is a valid binding URI. Since we can't do URL resolution during parallel
    2622             : // style struct computation, we can't just null out the binding if the URL turns
    2623             : // out to be invalid. As such, we use this wrapper class to maintain this
    2624             : // behavior dynamically.
    2625             : class BindingHolder {
    2626             : public:
    2627             :   BindingHolder() {}
    2628             :   explicit BindingHolder(mozilla::css::URLValue* aPtr) : mPtr(aPtr) {}
    2629             :   operator mozilla::css::URLValue*() const { return Get(); }
    2630             :   mozilla::css::URLValue* operator->() const { return Get(); }
    2631             :   mozilla::css::URLValue* Get() const { return (mPtr && mPtr->GetURI()) ? mPtr.get() : nullptr; }
    2632             :   mozilla::css::URLValue* ForceGet() const { return mPtr.get(); }
    2633             :   void Set(mozilla::css::URLValue* aPtr) { mPtr = aPtr; }
    2634             : private:
    2635             :   RefPtr<mozilla::css::URLValue> mPtr;
    2636             : };

    3536             : private:
    3537             :   // Flags to represent the use of context-fill and context-stroke
    3538             :   // for fill-opacity or stroke-opacity, and context-value for stroke-dasharray,
    3539             :   // stroke-dashoffset and stroke-width.
    3540             :   enum {
    3541             :     FILL_OPACITY_SOURCE_MASK   = 0x03,  // fill-opacity: context-{fill,stroke}
    3542             :     STROKE_OPACITY_SOURCE_MASK = 0x0C,  // stroke-opacity: context-{fill,stroke}
    3543             :     STROKE_DASHARRAY_CONTEXT   = 0x10,  // stroke-dasharray: context-value
    3544             :     STROKE_DASHOFFSET_CONTEXT  = 0x20,  // stroke-dashoffset: context-value
    3545             :     STROKE_WIDTH_CONTEXT       = 0x40,  // stroke-width: context-value
    3546             :     FILL_OPACITY_SOURCE_SHIFT   = 0,
    3547             :     STROKE_OPACITY_SOURCE_SHIFT = 2,
    3548             :   };
